Name: Starfire: Insurrection
Description:
Insurrection is a scenario supplement for Third Edition Starfire, based upon the novel "Insurrection" written by David Weber and Steve White.

After the Fourth Interstellar War, the Terran corporate worlds had gained a concentration of political, economic, and social power compared to the fringe worlds. 
Corporate world politicians invited the Khanate of Orion to a political union in order to dilute the political power of the fringe and the fringe responded by withdrawing from the Terran Federation and starting a civil war.

This supplement includes new technologies for HT14 and HT15.

Insurrection requires the 3rd Edition Tactical Rulebook to play out the scenarios that are included as part of the story line.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paw Patrol Ultimate Rescue: Save the Forest
Description: Help Marshall save the forest! In this fun preschool game, kids collaborate to put out fires with their favorite pup. Play solo or with up to four players and take turns spinning the arrow on the board. If the arrow lands on a flame, place a flame-piece on the forest cards. If the arrow lands on a water drop, remove a flame piece. Once all the flames have been removed from a forest card, you've saved The forest! If all the flame spaces on a forest card are filled, this forest burns up. But don't forget – you've got your trusty Pup pal to help out! If the dial lands on Marshall, move the Marshall figure (included) to the forest card. If Marshall is on a forest card, It can never have flames added to it. Once all four forest cards have been saved or lost, calculate your score to see how you and Marshall did. A great way to encourage teamwork, This fun game lets kids embark on an exciting mission with their favorite pup. Help Marshall on an ultimate rescue with the save the forest board game!

Name: Perfect Earth: Orangutans
Description:
A unique board game for the entire family, about the impact of deforestation on the Orangutans of Borneo and Sumatra.

It’s a shocking sight, as the game board unfolds on the table. A beautiful area of rainforest has been cut down to make way for yet another palm oil plantation. The very center of the deforested area has been spared as it is host to trees producing smelly durian fruit. The exploiters of the future plantation simply could not stand the smell and left this small group of trees alone. Contrary to the loggers, Borneo orangutans love durian fruit, but their access to the trees has now been cut off. Orangutans nearly solely travel through tree tops, swinging elegantly at impressive speeds. They hardly ever travel over the ground, so how do they now get to their favorite meal in the rainforest? You can help them, by growing back the rainforest.

Role the dice to determine your action for each turn. Actions include placing a new rainforest tile, introducing an orangutan chit, moving a rainforest tile, or moving an orangutan chit (1 or 2 moves).

Players aim to create a path for their orangutans to swing to the durian trees in the center of the board. They have to avoid blood pythons and can make use of other orangutan tiles or chits (including those of opponent players), which will help them move faster towards the durian trees. The first player to feed all of his/her orangutans, by occupying the durian trees, wins!

-description from designer

Name: Be Excellent to the Future
Description:
Some most bodacious dudes have fixed the past, saved the world, and everyone is being excellent to each other! But Chuck Tannen, former gym teacher, high school bully, and a total butthole, is using time travel to enact his bogus plots. In the process, he’ll ruin not only history, but the entire future of humanity. Heavy. Fortunately, if the dickweeds can use time travel to ruin everything, you can use it to fix everything!

Take on the roles of the most excellent William, Martin, and Theodore, along with the heinous Chuck Tannen to weave together plans for breaking, or fixing, history.

BETTF is a partytelling game where players contribute story detail cards for other players to use in their efforts to manipulate history to their own ends. The dickweeds tell their plans for changing history based on a goal card they want to achieve and an event card they will target. Then the righteous dudes use detail cards their future selves put there for them to figure out how to stop the dickweeds.

Once everyone has played both roles twice, the player with the most used helpful detail cards wins. Most triumphant!

—description from the designer

Name: SkyTech
Description:
SkyTech - a game family about combat operations in near-planetary spaces of the distant future, in the most dangerous part of them - the area of low heights.
Players are expected by dashing squadrons of roaring skytes - flying combat vehicles of the galactic outskirts and their fearless pilots, heavy anti-aircraft gun fire and the frightening slow pace of walking tanks, devastating bombing raids and the approaching screech of combat missiles, the heroic fatality of aimed rams and the highest tension of pilots at the moment of ejection!

Name: Poll Mania Football
Description:
Poll Mania Football is a game that simulates a college football season, by following the games and rankings of the Top 20 teams. Each week you will resolve all the games for the ranked teams, rolling dice for each team's score and adjusting the result by the team ratings. Each team has ratings for offense and defense, home and away. After each week's games are completed, you will calculate the rankings for the next week using simple addition and subtraction, to simulate a real college football poll.

—description from the designer

Name: Pirate Coast (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description: This expansion by Hawkinsssable features 15 Coast Tiles, 13 River Tiles (almost none of which can be found in existing Rivers expansions), 4 pirate logo tiles (or separate printable pirate logos to add to existing base game tiles), and a little 2-tile pirate island to help keep track of your pirate meeples. It also features an additional optional 19-tile expansion of all-new tiles which mix in functionality from other CarcassonneCentral expansions such as Mountains, Forests and Wells.

Name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.2 1420-1783
Description:
2nd volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume covers the Pike & Shot and 18th century eras.
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession
Series: War Games Through the Ages (Donald F. Featherstone)

Name: Captain's Log: Crisis Detected
Description:
CAPTAIN’S LOG: CRISIS DETECTED is a space themed competitive card game. Players act as Captains and command a fleet of spaceships holding valuable cargo. The deck is made up of cards that can protect your ships, attack opponents ships, and interact with another player's actions. Choose your targets wisely as the game may require you to form an alliance to stay alive.  The game ends when one player has all their ships destroyed with the winner being the one with the most valuable cargo remaining.

Now available for pre-order on the official Captain's Log: Crisis Detected Page: https://www.tallymarkentertainment.com/shop/p/captains-log-crisis-detected

Name: Star Travelers: The Game
Description:
Players begin the game preparing for their journey by finding and training crew, upgrading their ship, and gathering supplies. Once all players have had a chance to get ready, you each set out into space, revealing tiles by using your ship's radar to discover planets, face aliens, and encounter random events along the way. Throughout the game, your actions will earn you rank marks that will determine the winner. Played on a modular board that is built as you play, Star Travelers combines classic mechanics with modern, modular components to keep game play fresh every time you play. Based on the sci-fi book series by author K. E. Knights.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Sable Scourge
Description:
The Sable Scourge is a semi-cooperative game played on an open world map. Players will use their turns to investigate areas of interest and stop the Sable Scourge and her henchmen from tearing up Bright City. Preventing these events and stopping the evil-doers can extend the game and give you more time to prepare for the final battle. Be careful though; if someone isn't at the right place at the right time, the final battle could approach faster. Use the glory you garner along the way to heal up, escape battles, and collect items. Every action can affect your renown (positive and negative), and the player with the most renown at the end is the winner.

Even though the game offer cooperation and teamwork skills, there is only one winner in the end, so don't share too much of the glory and claim all the renown for yourself to be the best hero Bright City has ever seen.

-description from publisher

Name: Heroes Vs. Foes
Description:
At the beginning of each level, players use hex tiles and a 6-sided die to randomly generate that levels dungeon map and starting boss position. On each turn, players will move (if they wish) and then choose an action: trade items, revive another hero, rest up, or search the area. When searching the area, the hero could find treasure, the level key, a foe to battle, or even a trap.

While battling foes and each level boss is encouraged in order to obtain higher levels through experience gains, once the key is located, the players can proceed through the door to the next level. A new board is generated, a new boss is drawn, and things get a little bit more difficult.

By the time players reach level five, the foes and level boss are extremely strong (this difficulty increase is directly related to the number of players in the game). The game ends when the boss on level 5 is defeated or when the boss on level 5 has knocked all heroes unconscious. Heroes Vs. Foes is a fully-cooperative game, so all players will win or lose together.

The standard edition offers 10 heroes to choose from (each with their own unique abilities, stats, and boons), 8 bosses, 27 foes, 57 items, 9 familiars, and 9 traps, making the possibilities of game play figuratively limitless. The game provides a mix of tabletop role-playing game and old-school dungeon crawler board game mechanics to generate a full campaign with long-term decisions while allowing all players to take part in the action. It has a moderate learning curve made easier with the more background in TTRPG and traditional dungeon-crawler stats and mechanics. Once moving, the game easily plays itself and provides difficulty and teamwork for even the most avid players.

-description from publisher

Name: Fish N Ships
Description:
What a time to be a pirate! You have gained a set of scrolls that lead you to magic fish! The more fish you collect, the more magic-y goodness courses through you. Destroy your enemies, gather your fish, and gain arcane magical dominion over the seven seas!

Fish N Ships is a quick combat & hand-management card game set in a fantastical world of swashbuckling seafarers. In Fish N Ships, each player takes on the role of a pirate who must follow the compass points on their scrolls in order to find the legendary fish and gain unique magic powers. Players fire cannons at each other, steal one another's cards, hoard treasure cards to claim special abilities, and play powerful Tide-Turner cards that can change the course of the game entirely.

Each player starts with four cards from the draw deck and a secret goal card listing their unique combination of treasure cards needed to win the game. The moment a player takes possession of the cards listed on their goal card, they immediately win and the game ends. Players may steal cards from each other's hands by engaging in battle, and could easily lose everything if sailing into battle unprepared. To mitigate (but not completely eliminate) the risk of losing their treasure cards, a player may choose to place a card face-up in front of them, making the card "Locked down" and immune to the effects of battle. The more treasures a player has locked down, the more special abilities they may claim. Special abilities (such as "+1 to Attack" and "Draw from discard pile") can only be claimed by one player at a time, encouraging players to race to be the first to claim the most desirable powers.

Fish N Ships uses a structure that rewards planning while also encouraging quick adaptation of play strategy. Players are never eliminated (even if they run out of cards) & are given equalizing bonuses if ganged up on repeatedly. Powerful single-use "Tide-Turner" cards are included in the deck that can be used outside a player's normal turn-actions to disrupt an opponent or bolster a winning streak. Once used, Tide-Turners are removed from the game, encouraging players to use them wisely.

All gameplay mechanics of Fish N Ships are designed to encourage player interaction, either through battle or theft. It is statistically impossible for a player to collect all the treasures listed on their goal card by solely drawing from the deck. Though a player may choose to play a pacifist for most of the game, they will be forced to fight an opponent eventually.  Combat is structured so that neither party will have an immediate advantage (other than the surprise of the initial attack) and the game encourages players to be prepared for battle at all times.

-description from designer

Name: Libertad! A Blitzkrieg Commander Supplement for the Spanish Civil War 1936-1939
Description:
Libertad! is a supplement for the popular Blitzkrieg Commander IV wargames rules, focussing on the Spanish Civil War from 1936-1939.

Written by Mark Fry and Rob Anderson, Libertad! contains 23 new army lists for the various factions present in this conflict, plus 5 historical scenarios complete with maps by Henry Hyde, as well as new rules for Line Commanders, Street Barricades, Molotov Cocktails and more.

A copy of Blitzkrieg Commander IV is needed to use this supplement.

Name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.3 1792-1859
Description:
3rd volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume starts with the French Revolution, cover the Napoleonic wars in details and up to the Franco-Austrian War.
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period.
Families: Series: War Games Through the Ages (Donald F. Featherstone)

Name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.4 1861-1945
Description:
4th volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume begins with the American Civil War, up to the end of WW2 (but not WW1)
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: War Games Through the Ages (Donald F. Featherstone)

Name: Captain Wonder Cape
Description:
What would the world be without toilet paper ?! After all, even superheroes have to go to the bathroom! Of course, it can happen that the paper gets tangled in your own superhero costume. Suddenly your fluttering cape is getting longer, but unfortunately it is no longer completely pure.

In Captain Wonder Cape, you play a dual role: As Captain Wonder Cape, each of you tries to pull the longest possible cape (i.e., strip of toilet paper) out of the box without ripping it — but you also have to give Professor P. a chance to perform dirty tricks on the strip of toilet paper.

Take on this delicate challenge, and whoever has drawn the longest toilet paper strip wins the game...and the title "Captain toilet brush".

—description from the publisher

Name: NEUROGOL: El fútbol ciencia
Description:
Neurogol is a football simulation which can be played by two people or by two teams of two players each.

Each team has 11 players on the field, plus five substitutes (there are also other modes with fewer players). Each player has a defined position. Depending on the positions, the players have different movement options, which are those of chess pieces. The goalkeeper moves like the king, the forward like the queen, etc.

On each turn, a team can move the ball up to three times (less if the opponent intercepts it), trying to move it into the opponent's goal.

Name: Funky Monkey
Description:
The Funky Monkeys are running through the forest. Everybody teases everybody else and all monkeys fool around, wild and loud. Just for mischief, they decide to take a test of courage: Who will be bold enough to aggravate the tiger by throwing a coconut right on his head? Find out and pass on face-down vine cards to one another. Who has the courage to reveal an opponent's card? Do you want to progress quickly in order to land exactly on the tiger? Or would you rather keep enough distance so that you won't end up in his claws? There's a lot going on in Funky Monkey... but don't get too boisterous!

—description from the publisher

Name: Jumping Cups
Description:
Whose cups will be the first to reach the target spaces? Your target spaces are also your opponent's starting spaces, though… And if one player is blocked on his way and can no longer move, the other player wins as well. Each turn, you may advance one of your cups. The moving range depends on the number of cups sitting on the space. If there are two cups on one space, for example, you have to move the cup on top two spaces forward. So you need to consider carefully
what cup to move in order not to inadvertently go beyond the running track.

—description from the publisher

Name: Siege
Description:
A one player game using a standard 54-card deck and one to three dice.

Send your castle's armies to protect it from the attackers and roll the dice to know the result of each fight. If the sum of any suit you couldn't stop top 25 points, you lose the game. Will you be able to finish the pile before it's too late?

Name: Les bois d'Alkekan
Description:
A two player game using a standard 54-card deck.

Each round, the top card of the draw pile is turned face up. It can be a treasure, a magic object, or a thief! Each player choses a card in his hand to try to get it or avoid it.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points win.

Name: Trok
Description:
Trok is a horror themed Living Card Game for two players, who pitch their armies against each other. Cards are either tangible (such as creatures) or intangible (such as spells or curses) and can be placed either in the attack area or the defence area of a player's layout, determining which of their stats will come into play. The goal is to reduce the opponent's life points from 20 to 0.

There are various expansion decks in addition to this base game.

Name: Dyadic
Description:
You have been transported to the Dyadic, a parallel world where strange, nocturnal beasts with glowing eyes hunt you out at night. You must collect the right resources in order to re open the portal and return home.

The game is played in rounds, with each round consisting of a Day phase and a Night phase.  In the Day phase, the three dice are rolled to determine what resources are available and the players draft cards based on the resources.  In the Night phase any cards not drafted are flipped over to reveal the monsters and the dice are re-rolled to determine the strength and health of the beasts.  The players then fight off the monsters to survive.

The rounds continue until a player has collected the correct set of cards.

Dyadic is a game for 2 to 3 players.

-description from designer

Name: Apex: Escape from the Apes
Description:
Apex: Escape from the Apes is a cooperative adventure game for the whole family. The players must work together to escape from a fierce band of angry apes to win the game.

The board depicts a bird's-eye view of the pyramid, rising out of a jungle. The adventurers' rescue helicopter will land on the top of the pyramid (center of the board). If everyone can reach the top of the jungle pyramid before the apes get there, they will be rescued.

Each player has three randomly-dealt cards which provide certain abilities or hindrances, and a little treasure as well. On each turn, a player rolls a die which moves all the apes. (There are simple rules guiding the Apes' movement, which increase the tension as the game goes on.) Then they roll a die for their own movement, with which they can move in any direction, around or up and down the pyramid levels. If a moving adventurer is in a space adjacent to another adventurer, they can help that companion to move up (or down) the levels. Also, leaving treasure on the path distracts the advancing Apes (but only temporarily).

Can your intrepid explorers get to the apex of the pyramid to be rescued? (Bonus points if they get rescued with some treasure left!)

-description from designer

Name: The Advertising Game
Description:
This is a rare game of advertising that was apparently released by an advertising agency.
Each player represents an ad agency of which there are 3 types (market oriented, heavy service and creative). The type can impact the ability to get certain types of accounts.

The board is a layout of Manhattan with players starting at Grand Central Station. Each city block is a square (actually a rectangle as it represents the short and long blocks in Manhattan from 42nd to 56th and from York to 5th Ave). The blocks contain the name of prospective advertising accounts with an entrance on one street or a Fluke. Movement is in any direction but must follow the one way streets.

When landing on Fluke you draw a card. When landing on an account you may solicit the account by drawing a card based on whether the account already has an ad agency. The odds of getting the account are 50/50 if it has no agency and 1/3 of stealing an account. You can protect your accounts from being stolen by adding a "creative team" (Spend more money when winning the account and make less when getting commission since you have to pay the team).

Accounts have names based on real companies such as Croke, Hineykins Beer, Sunka Coffee and you can never have 2 accounts for similar products at the same time.

Name: Dirt Dog
Description:
Use the unique skill of your pup to overcome obstacles and catch prized quarries in the underground world of Dirt Dog. Create challenges for your opponent to find out whose dog has the most moxie in the end!

Loosely based on the real world dog sport of Earth Dog, the game Dirt Dog has players leading their dog through underground burrows to try and track down quarry.  Badgers, foxes, rabbits, and others are all things for your dog to chase.

Play begins with players drafting obedience cards, which are used to help their dogs overcome obstacles within the burrows.  One player then constructs a burrow for the other player to run.  While running the burrow, both players may use obedience cards to make the challenges easier or more difficult for the dogs.  Failing to meet a challenge saps some of the dogs moxie, which is needed to make it through the burrow and defeat the quarry at the end.  The dog with the most moxie at the end of the round wins that round.  Best of 3 rounds wins the game.

Dirt Dog is playable as either a head vs head game or team vs team.  Team games have 2 players per team, called a brace.  Players in a brace help each other successfully run through burrows to try and make sure they make it to the end with more moxie than their opponents.

—description from the designer

Name: Peli und Pelinchens Reise um die Welt
Description:
The players start at space 1 (Zoo), the first to reach space 191 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Bodosan-Spiel
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: King of Tokyo: Super Jump Goodie Card
Description:
Promo Card for King of Tokyo created to advertise the King of Tokyo: Dark Edition. Distribution of this item was disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic and is pending as of October 2020. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card is same as the one found in the King of Tokyo: Promo Cards, only the artwork is new.


Shuffle the card with the rest of the deck.

Card cost "4"

KEEP

"On each player's turn, you may spend 1 energy to negate the loss of 1 damage."

Name: Pack o' Dogs
Description:
Pack o’ Dogs is a quick 2-player card game featuring unique artwork of 40 dogs and 4 cats. Both players flip their cards over for simultaneous play. Form packs on the table with a hierarchy of determining which card is best when. The dogs form their packs with dogs of the same size, or dogs of neighboring sizes in the same color. Cats are unique, befriending the smallest and the largest dogs in their color, as well as other cats.

Pack o’ Dogs has two included versions in the rules: the Base Game and the Complex Game.

The Base Game has a little less strategy than the Complex Game so it is perfect for first time players, younger kids, or when you simply just want a faster more relaxed game. The scoring is based on the number of cards you have in your score pile and the game ends when you reach the bottom of the deck (no reshuffling the discard pile). The score pad is not used for this version.

The Complex Game requires more strategy than the Base Game. It involves planning out your moves, remembering what cards you know your opponent has, and which cards have already gone past to determine the best card to play. The game consists of a best of 7 rounds (i.e. first player to win 4 rounds ends the game, but doesn’t necessarily win the game). The score pad is used to write down your points for each round and tells you which rounds give you bonus points. You get bonus points for winning streaks and for winning the later rounds, so winning that final round could turn the whole game around!

Contents:
Deck of 45 Cards - 4 colors (white, red, black, yellow) of various sizes (numbers 1-10 and a cat, for each color), and 1 treat card
6 Reference Cards - 3 for each player for quick rule reminders
1 Score Pad - 20 sheets with 3 games per sheet (60 games total)
1 Rule Sheet

-description from publisher

Name: Word Hustle
Description:
Can you arrange your letter tiles to make the highest-scoring crossword grid?

In Word Hustle, after a letter draft during setup, you'll press your luck and roll your dice to gain more letter tiles. Then, you’ll race against others to make a high-scoring crossword grid. Over three rounds, you’ll try to maximize the scoring power of your personal letter set to win. Word games like Word Hustle – that let you move your letters around to find words – are incredibly satisfying.

In this word game, you won't be sitting idly waiting for your turn. There's simultaneous word-building and player interaction in each phase – you can steal or share letters and make strategic moves to win.

Word Hustle’s unique challenge of having to make new and better words with the same letters each round means the game gets MORE and MORE exciting. It turns out, the human brain loves this challenge. Word Hustle will lead you to consider moves like:

• Should I steal that valuable tile or go for more tiles for myself?
• Should I make words quickly and put pressure on my opponents or take my time and make high-scoring words?
• Can I outscore my previous round using the same letters but new words?

The player with the most points after three rounds is the winner, unless they are challenged to an Ultimate Hustle! In the optional Ultimate Hustle, the winner hands over their letter set to see if their final round score can be outdone… But, it won't be easy – the challenger only has two minutes and can’t use any of the words the winner used in the game.

Name: Fiveaside: Football Card Game
Description:
The 'beautiful game' in beautiful 8-bit design.
Based on the '5-a-side' format of the game played all over the world, the ambition was to create a fun, fast and nostalgic game for football (soccer) 'heads' - featuring cult players from recent years in 8-bit style.

We're football fans first and foremost, coupled with a love for classic video games and re-emergence of the retro gaming scene, the combination of a football card game with 8-bit influence felt like a fantastic combination - with ALL ORIGINAL ARTWORK. We wanted to produce something different than a standard tuck box of suited cards and also steer away from the classic 'trumps' format - although good for sports stats, there isn't much variety and this needed to be more original.

In short, you try and build your best 5-a-side team from a deck of current and classic players and score goals/points by having the team that totals the most stars at 'Kick-off'. More on mechanic and rules below.

Gameplay summary:
You are dealt 5 cards each
players take turns to draw a player card, then a referee card
the aim is to build a legitimate formation of GK DF MF MF ST, at that point you can initiate a Kick-Off, where all players
lay their cards down and the player with the most stars total scores a goal, first to 5 goals wins. But the Referee cards are designed to make that tricky and fun!

—description from the designer

Name: As You 'Wich
Description:
A delicious (and sometimes disgusting) card game that has one goal, build the best sandwich you can and convince your opponents it's the best they've ever seen. As You 'Wich is an ecstatic celebration of mankind's greatest invention: the sandwich. From hot pitas stuffed with falafel to fresh baguettes with ham and butter, every corner of the world has its sandwich, and its people have their sandwich opinions.

Each player starts with 5 cards. Players then draw cards or take from the three piles of cards in the middle (known as “The Sandwich  Store”). Gameplay continues until each store is forcefully closed. Then players take turns to pitch their creation.

Once all sandwiches have been pitched, on the count of three, players point and pick the best sandwich. The best sandwich wins the round. The chef who wins the most rounds wins the game!

Name: Battlefield: Space
Description: The third game in the "Battlefield" series expands the game to the stars. Each of two players has a deck of 72 cards which represent an alliance of space fleets from several alien races. The two sides differ in the fleets and their capabilities, but the forces are equal in their effectiveness through combinations of powers and tactics. Deploy your warships to the battle coordinates, assign your available reinforcements, and deal with the anomalies that can occur in the depths of space. Winners go on to fight in future encounters, while the losers are blown to oblivion. Through a series of skirmishes, each space force will be reduced to their most powerful fleets, and will finally meet in a glorious battle for supremacy in the galaxy!

Name: Split Second: Solitaire Firefights Against The Clock
Description:
Split Second is a card-based wargame where the player controls a team of soldiers referred to as Operators in special operations and SWAT-style missions involving violent resolutions. 
The game is played using cards to represent the physical components of the battlespace, dice to resolve actions with uncertain outcomes, tokens for recording some effects, and a timer to apply pressure to the player's decision-making process.

The player chooses a Mission from the Mission Dossier, which will include a roster of cards that represent the environment with pieces of cover, doors, and other elements referred to as Props as well as cards representing the opposition referred to as Hostiles. These cards are combined into small decks in a manner that uses randomization and fixed elements to form an Encounter. The same Encounter can play out differently each time it is played because of the randomization of the cards, forcing the player to think on their feet and adapt to changing circumstances. This also makes each scenario highly replayable.

Unlike most games that use a board with spaces or miniatures on a playing surface, in Split Second the playing area is abstracted using cards to represent the battlefield. 
Ranges aren't measured in physical distance, but instead cards are placed into Areas that are split up by Area Divider cards. 
Movement between objects isn't made in any linear measurement, but in movement points as the combatants anchor themselves to and then move away from objects in the battlezone.

—description from the publisher

Name: Feudal Patrol
Description:
Skirmish Miniature Gaming in Ancient, Medieval & Fantasy Periods.

- Covers all prefirearm period from cavemen to pike men plus fantasy!
- Use any figures / any single basing / any scale
- Games use 20 to 50 figures per side and plays in 2 to 3 hours
- Designed for solo, 2 player, and team play
- Double random activation provides for fog of war, drama and unpredictability
- Streamlined, intuitive combat resolution using a unique card based system eliminates cross referencing charts and tables

Name: Commissioned: The Call
Description:
This is the first formal expansion to the base game Commissioned.

The Call explores the reality of broken people working and living together inside the church.

The Call includes 2 new Apostles, 2 new Scenarios, 9 Trials, a Solo Play Mode, and a Chain Module to deepen the deck-building & player interactions in the base game.

-description from designer

Name: Movie Plotz
Description:
This is a ONE CARD version of Movie Plotz, conveniently printed on plastic so that you can put it in your wallet! It's the size of a credit card and offers the Movie Plotz experience in an even smaller footprint.

—description from the publisher


Movie Plotz is a wild game that allows your group to create hilarious fake movie storylines, then pitch them out loud for maximum laughs. Movie Plotz was designed as a very effective team building event that has evolved into a crazy party game where everyone contributes to the fun.

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then choose a challenge/modifier from a list (instead of a card) to modify the movie concept. With each change, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

Depending on the rules variation that you choose to play, the player with the most points will win.

Name: Iron Pirate: The Swashbuckling Train Race
Description:
Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race is a worker placement, race against the board, semi co-operative game that plays 2-4 (Solo mode being investigated) in approximately 45-90 minutes.

Gather resources from the sea locked islands by sailing the Njall Sea. But watch out for those pesky pirates looking to steal your hard earned resources. Try your luck at "Liars Dice" in the Tavern and walk away with a handful of coins, or maybe you might lose?

Fancy fighting those pirates? Why not buy yourself a cannon or two to upgrade your ship before blasting them out of the water

Work together to complete the track before Watkins Railway or face losing out on that big contract.....

All this, and more, in Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race

On your turn, you must first place a worker (Phase 1) on an available slot (In the first round, this will only be the mainland). Each player places one worker each in turn before repeating again. In round 1, you start with 2 workers each.
Do you try your hand in the tavern to gain coins? Do you go to market to buy resources? Do you upgrade your ship at the shipwright? Do you load your worker onto your ship

Once all workers are placed, any one who has boarded their ship may now sail their ship the relevant number of spaces (after round 1, this will only be 1 space as upgrades do not take effect until the end of the round). Each player who is on a ship will state which number sea region they wish to move to and then activate the pirate deck the required number of times dealing with any action points on the card(s).

Phase 3 is where workers return back to your player boards

Phase 4 is where your ships are upgraded, more pirates are added to the board and the round marker moves along

The game ends after 10 rounds and the player with the most points wins. However, if the board wins, I.E, if you don't complete the railway before the board does, then you are only playing for pride.

—description from the publisher

Name: Taiping Era: Commanders
Description:
This booklet is a supplement to Taiping Era.

It contains the commander cards for all of the commanders in Taiping Era, plus extras such as "Chinese" Gordon, the Commanders of British forces in the 1840 Opium War, as well as blanks for players to create their own.

“Taiping Era” is a set of wargame rules for fighting land battles in the turbulent middle years of the 19th century. 
Commanders are represented in the game by a model figure, as in most tabletop wargames. However, each commander can have unique abilities, so that he performs differently on the battlefield to all other commanders.
Commanders are allocated at both Army and Divisional level and their abilities are adjusted to take their relative levels of seniority into account.
The Commander’s abilities can be summarised on small cards, to be placed with the figure or held at the back of the board for reference. Cards for many of the armies covered by the rules are given in this small document, together with blanks for the user to complete themselves.

—description from the publisher and rulebook
Families: History: Opium Wars and Taiping Rebellion

Name: Flock of Sheep
Description:
Ages 6+

A game where sheep leave their pen and then flock together. Your goal is to end up with the most sheep of your color.

There are 12 2x2unit tiles (called "sheep") comprising 2 sets of reversible tiles with black sheep on one side and white sheep on the other, having Black: White ratios of {6:1, 5:2, 4:3, 3:4, 2:5, 1:6).

One set black-up is randomly mixed with the other set white-up and then randomly dealt out in a ring enclosing the 9 central points of a go board, forming a pen.

Movement
On a turn, Sheep always move a distance of exactly 5, and if not forming a flock, they then flip over. They are allowed one change of direction per move.

The game has two phases: 1) Dispersing from the pen, 2) Flocking together.

1) Dispersing from the pen,
During the Dispersing phase, priority is given to moving sheep that have the most length of shared edges. The sheep must move to reduce the total length of connections, and the number of touching corners. The Dispersing phase ends when no sheep are touching each other.

2) Flocking together.
During this phase, the sheep may move next to one another. When they end up sharing more than a corner with other friendly sheep, they form a flock and are not required to complete the turn with is flip. Flocked sheep no longer move and may not be flipped.

It is not allowed to repeat board positions during play (for example by returning a piece that the other player just moved)

The game ends when all the sheep are in Flocks.

Note: Many thanks to Dale Walton for all of his suggestions and concise wording of the rules.

-description from designer

Name: Cracker Games: The Imp Box
Description:
One giant cracker. Six brilliant games.

Six family games in a giant twist-end cracker. Gorgeous, high quality components and completely plastic-free. Reusable, re-playable and highly innovative.

A perfect addition to your Christmas table.


     In IMPulsive, you vote tactically to win cubes from your opponents while keeping your own safe.
     In IMPressive, you’re trying to collect sets of imps by choosing from a line up of available cards with ascending costs. 
     In IMPetuous, speed is of the essence. Flip cards, spot matches and gain points.
     In IMPatient, you are subtly trying to influence the outcome of an imp race.
     In IMPrudent, you need cubes and you need cards, but each turn you have to prioritise.
     In IMPassive, your aim is to manipulate the value of imps while ending up with the highest scoring cards.



But there’s no need to stop there. The cracker game components also form a neat little kit for families who’d like to get started in game design.

The Cracker Games also come with six puzzles, a board game design challenge booklet and six terrible jokes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Potion-Making (Gift Edition)
Description:
This Gift Edition includes Practice, University Course and Guild of Alchemists. In addition, in the box there are also bonus materials that are absent in the regular editions of the game: the Alchemikote creature card and alternative sequences for creating the Philosopher's Stone for the Alchemists Guild.


In the card game Potion-Making: Practice, players take on the roles of apprentice mages studying in a Magic School. Each player tries to gather the necessary components in order to produce magic elixirs, powders, talismans and even magical creatures. For each completed creation the player scores points – and the harder the task, the more points a player scores.

The deck consists of 76 cards, with each card featuring one of 16 elements on its bottom half and a magic formula or spell on its top half. Each player start the game with four cards in hand, and four cards are laid face-up in the "Desk of Elements"; players can use these public elements to complete a formula in hand.

On a turn, a player draws until he has five cards in hand, then he plays one or more cards from his hand. He can:


    Discard a card onto the Desk of Elements; he scores one point if that element is not currently present on the Desk.
    Take elements on the Desk to complete a formula on a card in his hand. He scores points equal to the number shown on the formula, then places the element cards face-down over the bottom half of the card so that all players can see the formula. His turn then ends.
    Use one or more previously completed formulas, along with any elements required and available on the Desk, to complete a more difficult formula. He can use formulas in front of himself or other players to do this. Any elements under formulas reused this way are returned to the Desk. Any opponent who loses one or more formulas this way scores half the points of the more difficult formula just completed. The player's turn then ends.
    Plays a spell from his hand to take a card from the desk into his hand, to decompose one completed formula or to transform one formula into another. After playing a spell, he must take another action, which could be playing another spell.


After the deck runs out, players continue to take turns until no one has cards remaining in hand. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Carbon City Zero: World Edition
Description:
The planet is in a climate crisis. For decades governments have ignored it. Now it’s up to a group of city mayors to sort it.

Carbon City Zero: World Edition is a race against the clock, where players juggle their common goal (of collective survival) with local priorities. And that’s just the start of it. From how people get from A to B, to what powers their cup of tea, every decision is a climate decision. These mayors have their work cut out for them - will they avoid climate chaos?

Carbon City Zero: World Edition is a revised second edition of the climate action game Carbon City Zero. This edition is a collaborative deck-building game for 1-4 people in which players develop a sustainable city by greening transport, transforming industries, getting citizens on board, and showing world leaders how it’s done. Each player starts with an identical deck, buying additional cards from a shared marketplace to create a more sustainable city. But you need to negotiate, working together with cities around the world. Balancing the need to generate income with reducing carbon, players can follow numerous paths to victory, but collaboration is key. You’ll need to bring together governments, industries, and the public. And if you can’t bring carbon levels to zero before it’s too late - we all lose. The stakes couldn’t be higher.

The game also comes with the original rules for competitive and solo play.

In the collaborative and solo modes players win if they can bring the carbon level to zero in eight rounds or less, while in competitive games it's a race to zero - first there wins!

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Blessed Aquila Promo Card
Description:
Blessed Aquila is a promo card that came with December 2018 White Dwarf issue.

Type: Ministorum Artefact

Effect: Once per exploration round, exhaust this card in the same manner as a resource card to re-roll 1 activation or action dice. This card does not turn face up at the start of the next turn. Instead, it is turned face up at the end of that exploration round.

Name: BUNGEE
Description:
Bungee is a patented dexterity game for homes, bars and pubs. Inspired by human-sand timers, darts, pong, dice and more, Bungee games allow you to relax with friends and family, while enjoying shared-sporty suspense!

Players aim to score points or gain important game tokens. Win conditions vary based on the rule set players select.

Bungee is a dexterity component with endless possibilities.

Try it and see what game bounces back at you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wajes Fußballschach!
Description:
This is a soccer simulation with programmed movement. After all playing figures have been alternately placed on the game board each player notes down 3 moves for his figures on his game chit. The moves are executed alternately. The team leading the ball begins. After the players have executed their moves, 3 new moves are noted down and so on. If the opposing player gets possession of the ball, the remaining movements are void and the players write down three new moves.

The figures move up to 5 spaces (3 if they lead the ball) in any direction.

The player with the most goals after a prearranged time wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Tu Letra
Description:
"Tu letra" is a quick, simple and fun word game and deduction.
Those who enjoy wordplay and are looking for something new to surprise friends and family can't help but try "Tu Letra"!

A player (director) looks at the letter he received (secret letter) and chooses the family of words the players should use.
The players in turn have to do the actions:
A) Say a word belonging to the family indicated by the director and ask if the secret letter is in it
If yes, add a card to your deck. If NO, place a card from the deck face up.
B) Try to guess what the letter is

If it is correct, the player gains one point.
If incorrect, the player must place 3 cards from his hand on the table.

The game ends when a player reaches three victory points.

Tu Letra es un juego de palabras y deducción rápido, sencillo y divertido.
¡Aquellos que disfruten de los juegos de palabras y estén buscando algo nuevo con lo que sorprender a amigos y familiares no pueden dejar de probar Tu Letra!

Name: We Shall Meet in Vienna: 1813 in Germany – The Spring Campaign to After the Armistice
Description:
We shall meet in Vienna includes everything you need to begin recreating the two phases of the War of Liberation in Germany: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

During the passionate negotiations of the spring of 1813 between France and Austria, Napoleon would dismiss Metternich by declaring, We shall meet in Vienna! threatening to repeat the capture of the Austrian capital as he had done in 1805 and again in 1809.

Desperately short of cavalry, having just raised a new army of largely raw recruits, rallying around a cadre of survivors from the invasion of Russia, Napoleon took command of La Grande Armée in the spring of 1813 determined to turn back the coalition forces seeking to dismantle the French Empire.

We shall meet in Vienna offers nine scenarios covering The Spring Campaign and the period After the Armistice: 

     1st Möckern
     Lützen 
     Bautzen 
     Großbeern – and a second scenario for Blankenfelde 
     Katzbach 
     Dresden 
     Hagelberg 
     1st Kulm 


250 pages, The Wargaming Company’s largest Campaign Guide to-date. 
Additionally, We shall meet in Vienna offers a late war uniform guide with over 1500 uniform plates, all in full color, covering every unit featured in the scenarios.

We shall meet in Vienna, 1813 in Germany is compatible with Et sans résultat! (both ESR Original Edition & ESR Second Edition), and nearly any other Napoleonic tabletop wargame. Orders of battle provide detail down to the battalion level and maps are offered in scale miles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Master of the World: 1812 in Russia – The Invasion
Description:
Master of the World, 1812 in Russia, Phase One: The Invasion
 The 1812 campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most well known campaign and one of the great tragedies of military history. It is also the story of Russia’s First Great Patriotic War, repelling a great invader. In excess of 600,000 soldiers and support personnel crossed the Niemen River from the Grand Duchy of Warsaw into Imperial Russia under the French Imperial flag beginning on 24 June, 1812.

Master of the World includes everything you need to begin recreating the first phase of Napoleon's disastrous 1812 Russian campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms. 

     One campaign
     Nine scenarios
     Twenty-seven maps
     Over 800 uniform images! 
     created especially for inclusion in this series and offering Nearly 200 pages


 
Let's start a land war in Asia…
 9 scenarios covering the French main army's advance to Moscow:

     Mir
     Saltanovka – Two versions: The Spoiler Attack and Clear the Way to Mogilev
     Ostrovno
     Vitebsk
     1st Krasne
     Smolensk – Two versions: Preserve the Army and Save the Holy City
     Lubino
     Schwardino
     Borodino


The Master of the World Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Most Awful Situation: 1814 in France – The Campaign of France & The Six Days
Description:
The Most Awful Situation, 1814 in France: The Campaign of France and The Six Days

After the crushing defeat of the French Army at Leipzig, a series of small actions allowed what was left to retire into France; but the hostilities continued through January as the Allies pressed vigorously. In mid-February the Emperor had determined to change the conditions of the war. Outnumbered four to one, the French would go on the offensive. Napoleon conducted the most brilliant campaign of his career: The Six Days; fighting and winning four battles in six days.

The Most Awful Situation includes everything you need to begin recreating the first two phases of 1814: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

     Two campaigns,
     Nine scenarios,
     Twenty-seven maps,
     hundreds of uniform images created especially for inclusion in this series and offering!


Outnumbered 4:1, bring it on…
10 scenarios covering both the initial Campaign of France and The Six Days:

     Hoogstraten
     1st Bar-sur-Aube
     Brienne
     La Rothière
     Lesmont
     Nogent
     Champaubert
     Montmirail
     Château-Thierry
     Vauchamps


The Most Awful Situation Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hero Realms: 5 Personaggi – Chierico, Guerriero, Ladro, Mago, Ranger
Description:
Go on an adventure with your friends, face perilous missions and fight against fearsome foes!

A character deck takes the place of the individual deck in the Hero Realms card game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This is a pack containing all 5 character decks which are usually sold separately.

Name: Pooman Cards
Description:
A twist on the family classic monster chases around the house, evolving it into a new format of flip and chase.

One player is the monsterous game-master Pooman, flipping the cards selected by the other players to reveal an array of characters.

Cards flipped reveal either collectable character cards, special cards or Pooman cards.

Character cards have puntastic names like 'Uriah Niles', and can have brown stars for players to bank points.

Special Cards can have powers to help defend against the Pooman, like freezing power of the 'Poocicle'.

If a Pooman is revealed then players must RUN the game-master will count to 10 and chase the player with the most stars; 
if any player is grabbed by the Pooman then all their cards are lost! First player to collect 5 brown stars wins!
Each pack includes 10 blank cards for players to create their own characters.

A new twist on an old classic - varying it so the chase is in short bursts and players can apply tactics and compete against other players to win victory over the Pooman.

Name: Loonacy: International Tabletop Day Expansion
Description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring the International Tabletop Day logo paired with images from the game.

Name: Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany: The Ulm and Austerlitz Campaigns
Description:
Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany, The Ulm & Austerlitz Campaigns

A series of small but pivotal engagements around the Ulm region allowed Napoleon to cut off nearly all routes of escape from Ulm and strategically surround the city. The Austerlitz Campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most effective campaign, culminating in one of the greatest successful gambles of military history. It is the campaign which introduced La Grande Armée to the world, a highly trained, highly motivated, flexibly organized military system which was the culmination and extension of military evolution to-date.

Roll up that Map includes everything you need to begin recreating both phases of Napoleon's brilliant 1805 German campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

     Two campaigns,
     Nine scenarios,
     Twenty-seven maps,
     Over 600 uniform images created especially for inclusion in this series and offering!


Sit under the sun of Austerlitz…
9 scenarios covering both the fight for Ulm, leading to the Battle of Austerlitz:

     Wertingen
     Haslach-Jungingen
     Günzburg
     Elchingen
     Amstetten
     Dürenstein
     Schöngrabern
     Wischau
     Austerlitz


The Roll up that Map Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher

Name: The First Battle Lost: 1809 in Germany –  The Bavarian Spring and Aspern-Essling Campaigns
Description:
The First Battle Lost includes everything you need to begin recreating the first two phases of the War of the 5th Coalition: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Archduke Charles, cautioned his brother, Emperor Francis, that Austria was unprepared for the war it was about to begin: …the first battle lost is a death sentence for the monarchy…

With his army concentrated in the Iberian Peninsula, Napoleon redirected all available forces to counter the Austrian declaration of war and its invasion of Bavaria.

The First Battle Lost offers ten scenarios covering The Bavarian Spring and the Aspern-Essling Campaign.

     Teugen-Hausen
     Dünzling (Thann)
     Abensberg
     Laichling (Eggmühl Day 1)
     Landshut
     Eckmühl (Eggmühl Day 2)
     Neumarkt-Sankt Veit
     Ratisbon (Regensburg)
     Ebelsberg
     Linz-Urfahr
     Aspern-Essling


In addition to hundreds of uniform images, covering every unit involved in the scenarios of the campaign!

The First Battle Lost, 1809 in Germany Campaign Guide is compatible with ESR Original Edition, ESR Second Edition, and nearly any other Napoleonic tabletop wargame.

Orders of battle provide detail down to the battalion level and maps are offered in scale miles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Didn't Dare Do Anything: 1812 in Russia  – The Flanks of the Invasion
Description:
Didn't Dare Do Anything is the first sequel to Master of the World, 1812 in Russia!
 When Napoleon invaded Russia in the summer of 1812, he detached forces both north and south to cover the flanks of the Main Army. The Russians were forced to respond by doing the same. But separated from their chief, the hesitant, and sometimes reluctant generals acted erratically. Their uncertainly made only worse by the Emperor's constant correspondence of orders, questions, and demands. 
Didn't Dare Do Anything provides scenarios pitting former allies like the Austrians and Russians against each other, as well as highlighting Russian initiative vs French hesitancy. Didn't Dare Do Anything is a unique look into the problems that would snowball to plague Napoleon's 1813 campaigns.

Didn't Dare Do Anything expands Master of the World!
You can choose to play the scenarios of Didn't Dare Do Anything alone, or as an expansion to Master of the World, expanding its campaign!

     Eight scenarios
     Twenty-four maps
     Hundreds of uniform images! 
     created especially for inclusion in this series and offering 
     Over 100 pages
     8 scenarios covering the flanks of Napoleon's invasion of Russian:
         Eckau
         Kobryn
         Yakubovo
         Klyastitsy
         Golovchtchitzy
         Swolna
         Gorodeczna
         1st Polotsk
    


Didn't Dare Do Anything is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher

Name: To Assure My Dynasty: 1808 in Iberia – The Uprising through the Emperor's Arrival
Description:
To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia 
 The entrance of the French Empire into a war on the Iberian Peninsula parallels numerous quagmires throughout history, initial success, which developed into a never ending burden. Having determined that the Spanish government did not hold the confidence of its people, and realizing, due to lack of both will and ability, it would never fulfill its responsibilities of allegiance to France, Napoleon determined plans must be made. Upon discovering agents of the Spanish throne discussed Spain’s potential role against France with her enemies, the Emperor decided such plans must be acted upon.
 The seemingly never ending pursuit actions across the Iberian landscape of Spain and Portugal provided a stream of empty victories to the French, until finally, the British Expeditionary Force is expelled from the continent at La Coruña.
 To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia presents Phase One: The Spanish Uprising in four scenarios, pitting Napoleon’s Imperial Army against the Royal Army of Spain, and the British Expeditionary Force and its Portuguese supporters. Followed by Phase Two: The Emperor's Arrival with another eight scenarios, ending with La Coruña.
 To Assure My Dynasty includes everything you need to begin recreating the opening phases of the Peninsular War: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

     Two campaigns
     Twelve scenarios
     Thirty-six maps
     Hundreds of uniform images! 
     created especially for inclusion in this series


 
The Emperor is coming to Spain…

     12 scenarios covering two campaigns…


 
The Spanish Uprising:

     Medina de Rióseco
     Bailén
     Roliça
     Vimeiro


 
The Emperor's Arrival:

     Zornoza
     Burgos o de Gamonal
     Espinosa de los Monteros
     Tudela
     Somosierra
     Cardedeu
     Molins de Rei
     La Coruña



The To Assure My Dynasty Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit: La Grande Guerre 1914 - 1918 – Liège
Description:
This is the mini edition of The Great War 1914-1918 of the famous game Trivial Pursuit.

In this edition, 330 questions for adults, and 330 more designed for the youngest.

The goal remains to be the first to fill in his pie chart by correctly answering the 6 categories of questions and obtaining the corresponding triangles.



     A l’occasion de la commémoration du centenaire de la Première Guerre Mondiale, la Province de Liège a prévu de nombreuses activités pour entretenir le souvenir de cet évènement. Mais, comment transmettre l’Histoire d’une nation, et de cette crise internationale spécifique, aux générations futures ? Nous avons relevé ce challenge en personnalisant un Trivial Pursuit qui valorise cet héritage historique.
     Cette édition thématique du troisième jeu le plus vendu au monde, spéciale « La Grande Guerre 1914 -­â€ 1918 » est l’occasion de parcourir les 330 questions qui sont réparties en 6 catégories. Les aspects géographiques sont abordés , de même que les personnes qui ont joué un rôle important, ainsi que les armes et le matériel utilisé, et surtout le rôle exemplaire de Liège dans la Grande Guerre.
     Le célèbre jeu Trivial Pursuit rime avec savoir et connaissances, tout en étant ludique. Il est le support idéal pour illustrer le conflit historique qu’est la Première Guerre Mondiale !

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Mons – Capitale européenne de la culture
Description:
A Trivial Pursuit about the city of Mons in Belgium. 
Created in 2015 on the occasion of the year of culture in the city.

Name: For Sale: Advisors
Description:
For Sale: Advisors adds a third phase to the classic game For Sale, with players starting the game by bidding to hire advisors who will then assist in the second and third phases of the game when players acquire houses, then sell them.

—description from publisher

Name: Anisoptera
Description:
Anisoptera is an abstract game where the objective is to organize a collection of dragonflies in the most optimal way in order to score you the most points.

Each turn you draw a card into your hand and then add a card to one end of the common display.  After three turns, score the matched symbols based on the final card in your hand.

-description from designer

Name: Drott
Description:
Drott is a chess like game played on a 13x13 hnefatafl board. Two opposing armies vie for victory via one of three win conditions. Either: 1. Defeat the opponent's king. 2. March the king into the castle (the center square) or 3. Invade conquer the opponent's fort. (the starting squares of the pieces).

Drott is designed to create local battles that will later impact the whole board. Therefore no pieces can move across the whole feature. Each piece is also used only once, and has unique movement. Fights are therefore dynamic and exiting.

Drott means king in old norse, and the game is lightly themed to fit the old kings of the north. The names of the pieces are, bowman, skjolding (pawns), berserker, spearman, wolf, elf, hunter, dwarf and king.

A special feature of Drott is that pieces diagonally aligned cannot be passed through, but there are two open flanks on the side. Due to the three winning conditions, draws are extremely unlikely to happen.

—description from the designer

Name: Crimson Skies: Spicy Air Tales – Volume 2
Description:
Supplements to FASA's 1998 Crimson Skies (a game of aerial combat), the two volumes were more than just flavor text. Spicy Air Tales Vol.1 and Spicy Air Tales Vol.2 provided additional scenarios to play with the base game, adding some of the features disclosed in the contained stories.


This entry is for the Volume 2.

Name: Cutterland: Cartridge Pack – Classics
Description:
Recharging fun!

In this box, you'll find a balanced set of 80 Landscape cards for the game of Cutterland. Keep creating fabulous lands and enjoying the classic gameplay!

Note: This is not a stand-alone game! The base game is required.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cutterland: Cartridge Pack – Mashroom
Description:
Mashroom Spawn!

In this box, you'll find a set of 80 Landscape cards for the game of Cutterland with a new monster — Mashroom! Play the familiar game and explore new combinations!

Mashroom
If there is at least 1 mashroom in an area, the area scores 2 VPs for each creature within it (including devoured creatures and the mashroom itself). Each area is scored only once.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Slave Ogryn Gang Tactics Cards
Description:
Expand your games of Necromunda with these 26 cards, representing the myriad tricks and schemes that can be used to gain an advantage in the underhive. As well as 18 gang-specific Tactics cards that perfectly encapsulate the way that Slave Ogryn gangs fight, there are also 8 blank Fighter cards for you to keep track of your gang.

This box contains 26 100mm x 75mm cards for used in games of Necromunda:


     18x Slave Ogryn gang-specific Tactics cards
     8x Blank Fighter cards


You will need a copy of Necromunda: Underhive, or Necromunda: Dark Uprising, and Necromunda: House of Chains to use the contents of this set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schnapp die Möpse: Ultimate Edition
Description:
The Ultimate Edition of Schnapp die Möpse consists of the base game and 2 Expansions in a big box.

The UE was published during the 2020 Kickstarter campaign for the second expansion for Schnapp die Möpse.

Kickstarter Stretch Goals:

     Big Paper Box (Upgrade to Ultimate Edition)
     3rd Mini-Expansion (Beyond)
     Active Player Marker
     7 Playerboards

Name: Cave Evil: Chaos Pack 2
Description:
18 new cards to add to Conjuration and other Decks

1 Mini Map "King of the Hell" 11" x 17" map that can be played on its own, added on top of other maps, or can extend maps.

—description from the publisher

Name: Those Magnificent Men
Description:
In 1923 a coalition of nations embarked on a convert mission of genocide. Deep in the Pacific Ocean the Last of the Strange forms of Man {Vampire, Werewolf, Merman, Mummy and Tinman} Tried to Fight off the Invaders.

You Play as a Three Man Crew of a Bi-plane Delivering goods, Rescuing Survivors and Shooting Down the Invaders.

The game plays in two phases.  After selected the objective card, the first phase, the players draft cards one at a time a choose whether to hire the crew, or build the map.  Once all players have 3 crew, the game moves to phase 2.

In phase 2, the players execute one of three action rows to pick goods, deliver goods, rescue survivors and shoot down invaders.

The game ends when the objective card is completed and the winner is the one with the most cash.

—description from the designer

Name: Ship Deck
Description:
Game for kids that reward good deeds while pretending to do cruise ship activities in this board game.

The game requires players to get to the pool with the most tokens. There are numerous onboard activities to be enjoyed.

HOW TO PLAY 

     Players choose a pawn and put it into the pawn stand. Place the cards and tokens next to the ship. Each player flicks the spinner, which determines where to go. 
     When players land on a card space, they pick a card. 3. Once all players are in the pool, all players count their tokens. The player with most tokens wins the game.

Name: Uglydolls: Adventures in Uglyville
Description:
Inspired by Uglydoll themes of adventure and acceptance. Players can imagine Uglydoll adventures as they move around the game board collecting cardboard goodies at the locations based on those in the movie. They can collect a teacup from lucky bat's tea house, or a heart from moxy's news stand, doggie sunglasses from Ugly dog's pet Shop, and more. Then it's a race to reach the Portal to the big world! The First player to land on the Portal space with a full pocket wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Gloria Goldberg Promo Cards
Description: This is a set of four promo cards for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, featuring a new investigator—the writer, Gloria Goldberg. They were included with copies of the novella Dark Revelations.
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – Books & Replacement Cards
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Beggar's Banquet
Description:
Most people in Medieval Europe suffered in abject poverty, many driven to begging in the streets, their survival at the mercy of the passing nobility. In this game, players take on the role of lowly beggars, visiting village sites in search of sustenance and working the passing nobility for largess. Players can chose to exploit their own infirmities, or visit the cathedral in hopes of a miracle. During this struggle for survival, beggars must also avoid the stern eye of the village constable patrolling the streets. The winner is the player who can acquire the most alms to survive in the harsh world for another day.

—description from the designer

Name: Bonnets, Bustles, and Boots
Description:
In the late 19th century, families and friends would gather in their parlors to play games. It was an aspect of their social life and a stage for the strict etiquette of the day. This three-handed card game would have been perfect for the Victorian courting sensibilities, played by a young couple and their chaperone. By playing your cards carefully you will gain cards that will contribute to your final score. However, you can decide to use a scoring card to win a different (and perhaps better) card. A very light, unique game for three that can be played almost anywhere by anyone, depicting the latest fashions of the 1880s. Remember the "good old days."

—description from the designer

Name: Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! Expanded Deluxe Edition
Description:
It’s been a fun existence, but someone tripped over a coolant cord in the core and the planet you’ve called home for eons is going to explode.

The objective of Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! is to be the first player to get their Aliens off the planet using resource cards, action cards‚ and phases of the moon.
- Lift Off! Get me off this Planet! is a fresh, lightweight take on unit placement and resource management. The cooperative-to-competitive dynamic and imminent doom creates strong tension and drama at the end of the game.
- It's an easy to learn, fast-paced game, where everyone feels engaged and "in it" until someone has won or the planet explodes!

The Expanded Deluxe Edition is the Original Game plus MUCH MORE
- Single Player mode with unique components
- Increased play count to 6
- New Exit Points
- New Lift Off Points
- The Gurglore
- A player Rocket Ships

-description from designer

Name: Cultivate
Description:
Plot, Draft and Plant. Make your garden thrive!
Cultivate is a spatial card-laying game for 1-4 players in which you will draft succulents, house plants, and cacti, then arrange them in your garden.

During the game, you’ll create your personal garden by laying and tucking cards, buying and placing trinkets, and covering all those pesky bugs. Score points by creating sets of plants with similar growing conditions and by carefully arranging your plot. The player whose garden thrives the most (earns the most points) wins!

This is the 2nd Game in the Quarks Series by XYZ Game Labs.

—description from the designer

Name: Bait & Switch
Description:
Bait & Switch is a two-part social deduction game for 3-9 players. Each round players will have to decide which crew to join to pull off a heist. After the heist, they’ll either keep their alliances and split the loot, or try to double cross the crew and keep it all for themselves. Played over 5 rounds, the winner is the player closest to 25 points without going over.

Collude, Collect & Double Cross?
You’ve got a heist to pull! You’ll need some extraordinary individuals with a very specific set of skills to join your crew. But once the crew has finished the job, who gets the loot?  Figure out who your real friends are to score big. And watch out, if you don’t spot the foe you could be left with nothing!

This is the third game in the XYZ Game Labs "Quarks" series.

Name: Asunder
Description:
Addictive worker placement strategy game with cooperative battle mechanics that offers rewarding variability and high replay value.

Set in the medieval city of Edgeport, Players assume the role of one of 5 guilds and prepare to defend the city from a Monster attack. The 5 guilds are Alchemist, Paladin, Warrior, Assassin and Necromancer. Each guild has a unique Prestige card that can be improved during the game to enhance abilities.

Players take turns placing workers (Acolytes) on action spaces to collect Influence (resource cubes) to enlist Champion cards, procure Equipment, or Improve their Guild Prestige. At the end of a set of rounds, gameplay transitions to a Battle between all of the players' Champions and a randomly revealed Monster card. Battle is cooperative and is incentivized as such by some of the Equipment.

The game ends after the last Monster Battle after 10 rounds, and the player with the most Victory Points (earned through all actions and Battle damage) wins!

Name: Código Secreto: Expansión promocional Chile
Description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Chile.
This promo pack is produced by Devir and it was given as a promo.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Waterloo et la Route Napoléon
Description:
The Trivial Pursuit Waterloo and the Route Napoléon, on the occasion of the bicentenary of the epic Battle between Napoleon and Wellington!

330 questions and answers on the theme of Waterloo and Napoleon's road.


Le Trivial Pursuit Waterloo et la Route Napoléon, à l'occasion du bicentenaire de la Bataille épique opposant Napoléon à Wellington !

330 questions et réponses sur le thème de Waterloo et la route de Napoléon.

Name: Monopoly: Animaniacs
Description:
Scene-stealing Warner siblings Yakko, Wakko, and Dot are joined by Pinky and the Brain and Dr. Otto von Scratchansniff in this reimagined Monopoly game. Players bounce around the board collecting other cast members, locations, and more from the 90s hit cartoon.

Monopoly original Description...
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Rhums & Cocktails
Description:
The Conficulture Quiz is your new card game to play with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the techniques and specialties "Rums & Cocktails" while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.


Le Quizz Conficulture est votre nouveau jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte des techniques et spécialités « Rhums & Cocktails » en vous amusant.

Vous êtes plutôt adepte de l’apéro ? Retrouvez immédiatement l’épisode : « Rhums & Cocktails »

Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Réunion
Description:
Card game to play with family or friends.
On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

This deck focuses on the heritage of the island of la Réunion.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied in a plastic box, convenient for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  
Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Ce jeu met l'accent sur le patrimoine de l'île de la Réunion.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

Name: 5150 Back Alley Bright Lights
Description:
Welcome to New Hope City, where everyone deserves a second chance.

Back Alleys, Bright Lights is the blend of lite Role-Playing with a quick and easy set of combat rules. Combined, these will enhance your games and move your Story along at a brisk pace. New Hope City is home to over a dozen different Races, some friendly and some not so. You can choose to play as one of over a dozen Professions, where what’s legal is up to your interpretation.

Totally playable solo with rules for a Campaign with a simple way to gauge how well, or bad, you’re doing! Compatible with our other 5150 rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 1 – Gastronomie: La Martinique
Description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to play with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Discover the Gastronomy of the "Martinique" destination while having fun.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Le Quizz Conficulture est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte de la Gastronomie de la destination « Martinique » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 1 – Gastronomie: La Guyane
Description:

Discover the Gastronomy of the “Guyana” destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.
