Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 1 – Gastronomie: La Guadeloupe
Description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the Gastronomy of the "Guadeloupe" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.

Partez à la découverte de la Gastronomie de la destination « Guadeloupe » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

Name: Roar and Write!: Deep Dive
Description:
The Deep Dive sheet pack gives you a new way to play Roar and Write, with new scoring opportunities and new council members to impress. Can you impress the council so that they choose you to rule the Kingdoms of the Deep?

Roar and Write! base game is a competitive press-your-luck game about impressing different council members on the selection committee, garnering favor throughout the five kingdoms, and completing your own personal objectives to rise to the top of the selection committee's choices for the new ruler of the Animal Kingdoms.

—description from the publisher

Do you have what it takes to win over the members on the Selection Committee before the time runs out?

Name: The Balkan Naval War
Description:
The Balkan Naval War is a mini campaign covering the naval side of the Balkan Wars of 1912-13 in the Black Sea, the Aegean and the Mediterranean.

The campaign has been written with LFG's Broadside and Salvo quick play rules in mind, but is adapable to any set of pre-dreadnought or WW1 naval rules.

Also included is a brief history of the naval campaign, the Broadside and Salvo fast play pre-dreadnought rules and a complete set of ship data in Broadside and Salvo format, allowing the campaign to be fought out over a weekend or a few club nights.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Broadside and Salvo (Long Face Games)

Name: Aeon's End: Return to Gravehold
Description: A small expansion for the cooperative deck builder Aeon's End consisting of two new mages, two new nemeses, new market cards, and new treasures for Expedition Mode.

Name: Aeon's End: Southern Village
Description: Promos from the "Aeon's End: Outcasts" campaign that were not Kickstarter exclusive went into the "Southern Village" expansion.  This expansion includes 1 new nemesis, 2 new mages, new market cards, and new treasures for Expedition Mode.

Name: Encapsulate
Description:
Encapsulate is a 2-4 player dexterity game where players each take turns flicking their colorful cubes onto a handmade wooden board consisting of a 7x7 grid.

If you get your cubes into a line, instead of flicking, you can take a scoring turn which removes any of your points-scoring cubes from the board. Orthogonal lines are good, but diagonal lines score even more points!

But the name of the game comes from your power to Encapsulate other players' cubes, even off turn. This not only scores you points, but removes your opponent's cubes from the board.

The score track is integrated into the board and other player's scoring markers, not to mention errant cubes, can allow your marker to leapfrog into the lead. Be the first to reach the end of the score track to win the game.

Name: Gamut
Description:
Gamut is a card game about colors.

The goal is to connect the primary colors between them, a player wins when they have no more cards in their hand.

As the game progresses, a beautiful pattern grows on the table.

Name: Kitchen Rush (Revised Edition): Time for Dessert!
Description:
It wasn't long ago that the players bought an old restaurant and received their first guests. Their restaurant grew, more demanding guests came and they were able to hire more staff. Unfortunately, the success didn't last long and the restaurant became quiet. The number of guests decreased, temporary workers had to be let go and not all damage in the restaurant could be repaired. So the players decided that the restaurant needed a change. It is high time to add a pastry shop to the restaurant and serve sweet desserts: tiramisu, crème brûlée and fancy sundaes – because it's Time for Dessert!?

The expansion Time for Dessert! introduces a new type of order. By taking advantage of additional actions and using ingredients such as fruit, cream and ice cream, the players have to satisfy the demanding wishes of the guests. A specialist helps to carry out actions twice in one go, but also needs more time to do so. If the players use their earned money for investments, these bring advantages in every shift. As in the basic game, all new rules are conveyed over the course of several scenarios.

While the story begins after the end of the last Kitchen Rush scenario, players only need to know the rules of the first four scenarios in order to play the expansion. Each of the seven new scenarios introduces new elements. Each group can decide for themselves whether they play the entire campaign or simply repeat the scenario that they enjoy the most.

-description from publisher

Name: No Way!
Description:
No Way! is best described as the game of bluff, lies and surprise. You win by a combination of conning your way to victory and sniffing out the bluffs and downright lies of other players. You'll learn some weird and wonderful 'facts' along the way, but to win in this game it's not what you know... it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to tell the truth (often stranger than fiction)or try to lie with a straight face. Select from the wacky but oddly believable falsehoods on the card, or take the plunge with a Double Bluff entirely of your own invention... that could double your points. Fortune favours the brave. The winner is the first to reach the 25-point target.

—description from the publisher

Name: OMFG!
Description:
This may be the rudest, shockingly funny bluffing game you have ever played! Can you sort out the facts from the fiction? Can you sniff out outrageous lies and downright bullshit? You'll learn some toe-curling and bewildering facts along the way - but to win this game it't not what you know, it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to speak the truth (often stranger than fiction) or dish out some deadpan deceit. Select from the scandalous, but oddly believable 'facts' on the card, or wing it with a Double Bluff that could pile on your points. Do you have what it takes to fool your friends? Do they?

A strictly adult party game, not for the easily embarrassed, to make you laugh out loud within the context of a genuinely competitive game. The winner is the first to reach 25 points.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crown the Unicorn
Description:
This is a fun children's tile game of search and find, suitable for anyone from 4 years old to grown ups. It's easy to set up and simple to play.

'The lion and the unicorn were fighting for the crown.' The unicorn won the crown, but the lion has chased her into the forest. As she escaped the unicorn dropped the crown somewhere on the forest path, where you have found it. You want to return her crown, but can you find the unicorn? Can you avoid the angry lion? Don't worry if you come across the dragon - he is friendly and will help you on your way.

Be the first to find and crown the unicorn.

—description from the publisher
